greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of squares of primes = 2 mod 3 dividing n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Additive with a(p^e) = p^2 if p = 2 (mod 3), 0 otherwise.
mathematica: Array[DivisorSum[#, #^2 &, And[PrimeQ@ #, Mod[#, 3] == 2] &] &, 85] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 11 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); sum(k=1, #f~, if (((p=f[k,1])%3) == 2, p^2)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 11 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
